data.text: And Elihu continued, and said,
Hear me, ye wise men;
For the ear tries words,
Let us choose judgment to ourselves:
For Job has said, I am righteous:
And he has erred in my judgment:
What man is as Job,
Saying, I have not sinned, nor committed ungodliness,
For thou shouldest not say, There shall be no visitation of a man,
Wherefore hear me, ye that are wise in heart:
Yea, he renders to a man accordingly as each of them does,
And thinkest thou that the Lord will do wrong,
And who is he that made the whole world under heaven,
For if he would confine,
All flesh would die together,
Take heed lest he rebuke thee:
Behold then the one that hates iniquities,
He is ungodly that says to a king, Thou art a transgressor,
Such a one as would not reverence the face of an honorable man,
But it shall turn out vanity to them, to cry and beseech a man;
For he surveys the works of men,
Neither shall there be a place for the workers of iniquity to hide themselves.
For he will not lay upon a man more than right.
For the Lord looks down upon all men,
Who discovers their works,
And he quite destroys the ungodly,
Because they turned aside from the law of God,
So as to bring before him the cry of the needy;
And he will give quiet, and who will condemn?
Causing a hypocrite to be king, because of the waywardness of the people.
For there is one that says to the Mighty One, I have received blessings; I will not take a pledge:
I will see apart from myself:
Will he take vengeance for it on thee,
Because the wise in heart shall say this,
But Job has not spoken with understanding,
Howbeit do thou learn, Job:
That we add not to our sins:
